update.description:
The pull request implements the generation and installation of xml schema files from sdf files.

For testing, I've imported 3 models of sdf:

* pendulum: an easy one
* turtlebot: medium complexity
* pr2: probably one of the largest out there. 

**Turtlebot test is currently failing**:  the turtlebot model is failing because there are `<include>` tags within a model, while I believe these are only acceptable for a world at the moment.

**PR2 test is currently failing**: *It doesn't like to have `/` characters in element text (i.e. `<script>Gazebo/Red</script>` in the material element). The pr2 test has four instances of this, which cause failures.*

Before merged, we must address this two failures in testing.

Thanks to @scpeters for the information about what is failing in the tests.
update.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

The pull request implements the generation and installation of xml schema files from sdf files.

For testing, I've imported 3 models of sdf:

* pendulum: an easy one
* turtlebot: medium complexity
* pr2: probably one of the largest out there. 

**Turtlebot test is currently failing**:  the turtlebot model is failing because there are `<include>` tags within a model, while I believe these are only acceptable for a world at the moment.

**PR2 test is currently failing**: *It doesn't like to have `/` characters in element text (i.e. `<script>Gazebo/Red</script>` in the material element). The pr2 test has four instances of this, which cause failures.*

Before merged, we must address this two failures in testing.

Thanks to @scpeters for the information about what is failing in the tests.

content.raw:
Update to the schemas in a56df8c.

Testing in a clone of the `gazebo_models` repo using:


```
#!c++

find . -name "*.sdf" -exec xmllint --noout --schema http://sdformat.org/schemas/root.xsd {} \;
```

Still need to fix exponential notation.
content.html:
Update to the schemas in a56df8c.

Testing in a clone of the gazebo_models repo using:

find . -name "*.sdf" -exec xmllint --noout --schema http://sdformat.org/schemas/root.xsd {} \;

Still need to fix exponential notation.

content.raw:
I just set up a loop to validate all the sdf files in `osrf/gazebo_models` (full results in [this gist](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/8d43f3c144a04101bfc4)). Two common errors popping up:

* vector3 or pose values with a floating point value between [-1,1] but without a leading 0: `.103`, `-.5`
~~~
./asphalt_plane/model-1_4.sdf:9: element size: Schemas validity error : Element 'size': [facet 'pattern'] The value '20 20 .1' is not accepted by the pattern '(\s*(-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?\s+){2}((-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?)'.
./asphalt_plane/model-1_4.sdf:9: element size: Schemas validity error : Element 'size': '20 20 .1' is not a valid value of the atomic type 'vector3'.
~~~
* extra whitespace in pose / vector3 tags:
~~~
./drc_practice_hand_wheel_valve/model-1_4.sdf:5: element pose: Schemas validity error : Element 'pose': [facet 'pattern'] The value '0 0 0.04445 0 0 0 ' is not accepted by the pattern '(\s*(-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?\s+){5}((-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?)'.
./drc_practice_hand_wheel_valve/model-1_4.sdf:5: element pose: Schemas validity error : Element 'pose': '0 0 0.04445 0 0 0 ' is not a valid value of the atomic type 'pose'.
~~~
content.html:
I just set up a loop to validate all the sdf files in osrf/gazebo_models (full results in this gist). Two common errors popping up:

  • vector3 or pose values with a floating point value between [-1,1] but without a leading 0: .103, -.5
./asphalt_plane/model-1_4.sdf:9: element size: Schemas validity error : Element 'size': [facet 'pattern'] The value '20 20 .1' is not accepted by the pattern '(\s*(-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?\s+){2}((-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?)'.
./asphalt_plane/model-1_4.sdf:9: element size: Schemas validity error : Element 'size': '20 20 .1' is not a valid value of the atomic type 'vector3'.
  • extra whitespace in pose / vector3 tags:
./drc_practice_hand_wheel_valve/model-1_4.sdf:5: element pose: Schemas validity error : Element 'pose': [facet 'pattern'] The value '0 0 0.04445 0 0 0 ' is not accepted by the pattern '(\s*(-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?\s+){5}((-|\+)?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]*)?)'.
./drc_practice_hand_wheel_valve/model-1_4.sdf:5: element pose: Schemas validity error : Element 'pose': '0 0 0.04445 0 0 0 ' is not a valid value of the atomic type 'pose'.

pullrequest.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

content.raw:
Jenkins on **Linux** is now happy. We were installing ruby1.9.1-dev but not ruby1.9.1.

 * http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/39/

For **homebrew**, we are really using the own formulae to get dependencies. It should be as easy as adding:

`depends_on 'ruby' => :build`
 
In **Windows**, since we changed to use 'workspaces' (not system installations but a whole zip to download into the user account)  with ignitions and now gazebo, I need to work a bit more on this to get it back to work.
content.html:
Jenkins on Linux is now happy. We were installing ruby1.9.1-dev but not ruby1.9.1.

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/39/

For homebrew, we are really using the own formulae to get dependencies. It should be as easy as adding:

depends_on 'ruby' => :build

In Windows, since we changed to use 'workspaces' (not system installations but a whole zip to download into the user account) with ignitions and now gazebo, I need to work a bit more on this to get it back to work.

content.raw:
The `@@` prefix means that this is a [class variable](http://rubymonk.com/learning/books/4-ruby-primer-ascent/chapters/45-more-classes/lessons/113-class-variables),
which is giving me some compiler errors on osx with ruby 2.1:
~~~
tools/xmlschema.rb:6: warning: class variable access from toplevel
tools/xmlschema.rb:246: warning: class variable access from toplevel
tools/xmlschema.rb:262: warning: class variable access from toplevel
tools/xmlschema.rb:265: warning: class variable access from top-level
...
~~~
Does it need to have the `@@`?
content.html:
The @@ prefix means that this is a class variable, which is giving me some compiler errors on osx with ruby 2.1:

tools/xmlschema.rb:6: warning: class variable access from toplevel
tools/xmlschema.rb:246: warning: class variable access from toplevel
tools/xmlschema.rb:262: warning: class variable access from toplevel
tools/xmlschema.rb:265: warning: class variable access from top-level
...

Does it need to have the @@?

pull_request.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

pullrequest.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

content.raw:
The test's should now pass. Here is what I did:

1. The PR2 model `<script>` definitions were missing the `<name>` child elements. This fixes the `Gazebo/<color>` problem.

1. Updated the `types.xsd` file to handle floating point numbers.

1. The urdf -> sdf converter outputs `<velocity_decay/>` elements. This conflicts with the original SDF definition that stated `<velocity_decay>` must have two child elements. I updated `link.sdf` to make the aforementioned elements optional.

1.  Update the `model.sdf` and `world.sdf` definitions to capture the allowable children of an `<include>` element.


With [Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/SDFormat/job/gazebo-any-sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/20/)
content.html:
The test's should now pass. Here is what I did:

  1. The PR2 model <script> definitions were missing the <name> child elements. This fixes the Gazebo/<color> problem.

  2. Updated the types.xsd file to handle floating point numbers.

  3. The urdf -> sdf converter outputs <velocity_decay/> elements. This conflicts with the original SDF definition that stated <velocity_decay> must have two child elements. I updated link.sdf to make the aforementioned elements optional.

  4. Update the model.sdf and world.sdf definitions to capture the allowable children of an <include> element.

With Jenkins

pull_request.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

update.description:
The pull request implements the generation and installation of xml schema files from sdf files.

For testing, I've imported 3 models of sdf:

* pendulum: an easy one
* turtlebot: medium complexity
* pr2: probably one of the largest out there. 

**Turtlebot test is currently failing**:  the turtlebot model is failing because there are `<include>` tags within a model, while I believe these are only acceptable for a world at the moment.

**PR2 test is currently failing**: *It doesn't like to have `/` characters in element text (i.e. `<script>Gazebo/Red</script>` in the material element). The pr2 test has four instances of this, which cause failures.*

Before merged, we must address this two failures in testing.

Thanks to @scpeters for the information about what is failing in the tests.
update.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

```
11: [ RUN      ] SDFSchemaGenerator.TestDoblePendulum
11: warning: failed to load external entity "/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/build/sdf/2.0/root.xsd"
11: Schemas parser error : Failed to locate the main schema resource at '/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/build/sdf/2.0/root.xsd'.
11: WXS schema /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/build/sdf/2.0/root.xsd failed to compile
11: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/sdformat-any-devel-trusty-amd64/sdformat/test/integration/schema_test.cc:46: Failure
11: Failed
11: Fail in parsing the model
```

Working on fixing it now.

The pull request implements the generation and installation of xml schema files from sdf files.

For testing, I've imported 3 models of sdf:

* pendulum: an easy one
* turtlebot: medium complexity
* pr2: probably one of the largest out there. 

**Turtlebot test is currently failing**:  the turtlebot model is failing because there are `<include>` tags within a model, while I believe these are only acceptable for a world at the moment.

**PR2 test is currently failing**: *It doesn't like to have `/` characters in element text (i.e. `<script>Gazebo/Red</script>` in the material element). The pr2 test has four instances of this, which cause failures.*

Before merged, we must address this two failures in testing.

pull_request.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

pullrequest.title: Implement generation of XML Schema files (issue #2)

content.raw:
Note also that ruby >= 1.9.1 is required. OSX 10.8 only has ruby 1.8 by default (though OSX 10.9 has ruby 2.0 by default). To upgrade OSX 10.8, I did:
~~~
$ brew tap homebrew/versions
$ brew install ruby193
~~~
content.html:
Note also that ruby >= 1.9.1 is required. OSX 10.8 only has ruby 1.8 by default (though OSX 10.9 has ruby 2.0 by default). To upgrade OSX 10.8, I did:

$ brew tap homebrew/versions
$ brew install ruby193
